channel.title: Papers with Code: Latest (unofficial)
channel.description: As a disclaimer, this is an unofficial feed and has no affiliation with Papers with Code.

item.title: Better by Default: Strong Pre-Tuned MLPs and Boosted Trees on Tabular Data
item.description: For classification and regression on tabular data, the dominance of gradient-boosted decision trees (GBDTs) has recently been challenged by often much slower deep learning methods with extensive hyperparameter tuning.

item.title: CanonicalFusion: Generating Drivable 3D Human Avatars from Multiple Images
item.description: We present a novel framework for reconstructing animatable human avatars from multiple images, termed CanonicalFusion.

item.title: Efficient GANs for Document Image Binarization Based on DWT and Normalization
item.description: To overcome this problem, this work introduces an efficient GAN method based on the three-stage network architecture that incorporates the Discrete Wavelet Transformation and normalization to reduce the input image size, which in turns, decrease both training and inference times.

item.title: Discovering symbolic expressions with parallelized tree search
item.description: Symbolic regression plays a crucial role in modern scientific research thanks to its capability of discovering concise and interpretable mathematical expressions from data.

item.title: OneRestore: A Universal Restoration Framework for Composite Degradation
item.description: In real-world scenarios, image impairments often manifest as composite degradations, presenting a complex interplay of elements such as low light, haze, rain, and snow.

item.title: PoPreRo: A New Dataset for Popularity Prediction of Romanian Reddit Posts
item.description: We thus believe that PoPreRo is a valuable resource that can be used to evaluate models on predicting the popularity of social media posts in Romanian.

item.title: Embracing Massive Medical Data
item.description: First, training AI all at once on such massive data is impractical as new scans/sources/classes continuously arrive.

item.title: PDiscoFormer: Relaxing Part Discovery Constraints with Vision Transformers
item.description: Computer vision methods that explicitly detect object parts and reason on them are a step towards inherently interpretable models.

item.title: BiosERC: Integrating Biography Speakers Supported by LLMs for ERC Tasks
item.description: In the Emotion Recognition in Conversation task, recent investigations have utilized attention mechanisms exploring relationships among utterances from intra- and inter-speakers for modeling emotional interaction between them.

item.title: Multi-modal Masked Siamese Network Improves Chest X-Ray Representation Learning
item.description: We evaluate our approach on three publicly available chest X-ray datasets, MIMIC-CXR, CheXpert, and NIH-14, using two vision transformer (ViT) backbones, specifically ViT-Tiny and ViT-Small.

item.title: Understanding the Role of Invariance in Transfer Learning
item.description: Using these datasets, we a) show that for learning representations with high transfer performance, invariance to the right transformations is as, or often more, important than most other factors such as the number of training samples, the model architecture and the identity of the pretraining classes, b) show conditions under which invariance can harm the ability to transfer representations and c) explore how transferable invariance is between tasks.

item.title: Hyperspectral Dataset and Deep Learning methods for Waste from Electric and Electronic Equipment Identification (WEEE)
item.description: In this paper, we evaluate the performance of diverse deep learning architectures for hyperspectral image segmentation.

item.title: Multi-Branch Auxiliary Fusion YOLO with Re-parameterization Heterogeneous Convolutional for accurate object detection
item.description: Meanwhile, the Advanced Assisted Fusion (AAF) module deeply embedded within the neck conveys a more diverse range of gradient information to the output layer.

item.title: T2IShield: Defending Against Backdoors on Text-to-Image Diffusion Models
item.description: In this paper, for the first time, we propose a comprehensive defense method named T2IShield to detect, localize, and mitigate such attacks.

item.title: Hindsight Preference Learning for Offline Preference-based Reinforcement Learning
item.description: Offline preference-based reinforcement learning (RL), which focuses on optimizing policies using human preferences between pairs of trajectory segments selected from an offline dataset, has emerged as a practical avenue for RL applications.

item.title: Unsupervised Learning of Category-Level 3D Pose from Object-Centric Videos
item.description: In a second step, the canonical poses and reconstructed meshes enable us to train a model for 3D pose estimation from a single image.

item.title: RAM: Retrieval-Based Affordance Transfer for Generalizable Zero-Shot Robotic Manipulation
item.description: First, RAM extracts unified affordance at scale from diverse sources of demonstrations including robotic data, human-object interaction (HOI) data, and custom data to construct a comprehensive affordance memory.

item.title: AnySR: Realizing Image Super-Resolution as Any-Scale, Any-Resource
item.description: As a contrast to off-the-shelf methods that solve SR tasks across various scales with the same computing costs, our AnySR innovates in: 1) building arbitrary-scale tasks as any-resource implementation, reducing resource requirements for smaller scales without additional parameters; 2) enhancing any-scale performance in a feature-interweaving fashion, inserting scale pairs into features at regular intervals and ensuring correct feature/scale processing.

item.title: Smart Vision-Language Reasoners
item.description: In this article, we employ the abstractions given in the SMART task (Simple Multimodal Algorithmic Reasoning Task) introduced in \cite{cherian2022deep} as meta-reasoning and problem-solving skills along eight axes: math, counting, path, measure, logic, spatial, and pattern.

item.title: Pretraining End-to-End Keyword Search with Automatically Discovered Acoustic Units
item.description: End-to-end (E2E) keyword search (KWS) has emerged as an alternative and complimentary approach to conventional keyword search which depends on the output of automatic speech recognition (ASR) systems.

item.title: AriGraph: Learning Knowledge Graph World Models with Episodic Memory for LLM Agents
item.description: We demonstrate that our Ariadne LLM agent, equipped with this proposed memory architecture augmented with planning and decision-making, effectively handles complex tasks on a zero-shot basis in the TextWorld environment.

item.title: PartCraft: Crafting Creative Objects by Parts
item.description: This paper propels creative control in generative visual AI by allowing users to "select".

item.title: Written Term Detection Improves Spoken Term Detection
item.description: End-to-end (E2E) approaches to keyword search (KWS) are considerably simpler in terms of training and indexing complexity when compared to approaches which use the output of automatic speech recognition (ASR) systems.

item.title: Exploration of Class Center for Fine-Grained Visual Classification
item.description: In particular, our method achieves state-of-the-art performance on the FGVC-Aircraft and CUB-200-2011 datasets.

item.title: Robust Q-Learning for finite ambiguity sets
item.description: In this paper we propose a novel $Q$-learning algorithm allowing to solve distributionally robust Markov decision problems for which the ambiguity set of probability measures can be chosen arbitrarily as long as it comprises only a finite amount of measures.

item.title: Learning to (Learn at Test Time): RNNs with Expressive Hidden States
item.description: We evaluate our instantiations at the scale of 125M to 1. 3B parameters, comparing with a strong Transformer and Mamba, a modern RNN.

item.title: SH17: A Dataset for Human Safety and Personal Protective Equipment Detection in Manufacturing Industry
item.description: Workplace accidents continue to pose significant risks for human safety, particularly in industries such as construction and manufacturing, and the necessity for effective Personal Protective Equipment (PPE) compliance has become increasingly paramount.

item.title: MARS: Paying more attention to visual attributes for text-based person search
item.description: The task is that of retrieving one or more images of a specific individual based on a textual description.

item.title: Isomorphic Pruning for Vision Models
item.description: For instance, we improve the accuracy of DeiT-Tiny from 74. 52% to 77. 50% by pruning an off-the-shelf DeiT-Base model.

item.title: Data-Driven Tissue- and Subject-Specific Elastic Regularization for Medical Image Registration
item.description: Physics-inspired regularization is desired for intra-patient image registration since it can effectively capture the biomechanical characteristics of anatomical structures.

item.title: Benchmarking Complex Instruction-Following with Multiple Constraints Composition
item.description: Existing benchmarks mainly focus on modeling different types of constraints in human instructions while neglecting the composition of different constraints, which is an indispensable constituent in complex instructions.

item.title: Beyond Pixels: Semi-Supervised Semantic Segmentation with a Multi-scale Patch-based Multi-Label Classifier
item.description: This patch classifier is trained to identify classes present within an image region, which facilitates the elimination of distractors and enhances the classification of small object segments.

item.title: Improving Self-supervised Pre-training using Accent-Specific Codebooks
item.description: Speech accents present a serious challenge to the performance of state-of-the-art end-to-end Automatic Speech Recognition (ASR) systems.

item.title: BM25S: Orders of magnitude faster lexical search via eager sparse scoring
item.description: We introduce BM25S, an efficient Python-based implementation of BM25 that only depends on Numpy and Scipy.

item.title: Core: Robust Factual Precision Scoring with Informative Sub-Claim Identification
item.description: Hallucinations -- the generation of untrue claims -- pose a challenge to the application of large language models (LLMs) [1] thereby motivating the development of metrics to evaluate factual precision.

item.title: Future Events as Backdoor Triggers: Investigating Temporal Vulnerabilities in LLMs
item.description: Backdoors are hidden behaviors that are only triggered once an AI system has been deployed.

item.title: An Autoencoder Architecture for L-band Passive Microwave Retrieval of Landscape Freeze-Thaw Cycle
item.description: Estimating the landscape and soil freeze-thaw (FT) dynamics in the Northern Hemisphere is crucial for understanding permafrost response to global warming and changes in regional and global carbon budgets.

item.title: Craftium: An Extensible Framework for Creating Reinforcement Learning Environments
item.description: Most Reinforcement Learning (RL) environments are created by adapting existing physics simulators or video games.

item.title: DotaMath: Decomposition of Thought with Code Assistance and Self-correction for Mathematical Reasoning
item.description: In this paper, we introduce a series of LLMs that employs the Decomposition of thought with code assistance and self-correction for mathematical reasoning, dubbed as DotaMath.

item.title: ROER: Regularized Optimal Experience Replay
item.description: We specifically explore the KL divergence as the regularizer and obtain a new form of prioritization scheme, the regularized optimal experience replay (ROER).

item.title: On the Workflows and Smells of Leaderboard Operations (LBOps): An Exploratory Study of Foundation Model Leaderboards
item.description: We then identify 8 unique types of leaderboard smells in LBOps.

item.title: TALENT: A Tabular Analytics and Learning Toolbox
item.description: Tabular data is one of the most common data sources in machine learning.

item.title: Biometric Authentication Based on Enhanced Remote Photoplethysmography Signal Morphology
item.description: In the second training stage, an rPPG-cPPG hybrid training is performed by incorporating external cPPG datasets to achieve rPPG biometric authentication and enhance rPPG signal morphology.

item.title: CoMix: A Comprehensive Benchmark for Multi-Task Comic Understanding
item.description: We introduce a novel benchmark, CoMix, designed to evaluate the multi-task capabilities of models in comic analysis.

item.title: Argument Mining in Data Scarce Settings: Cross-lingual Transfer and Few-shot Techniques
item.description: Contrary to previous work, we show that for Argument Mining data transfer obtains better results than model-transfer and that fine-tuning outperforms few-shot methods.

item.title: Leveraging Latent Diffusion Models for Training-Free In-Distribution Data Augmentation for Surface Defect Detection
item.description: Usually, defect detection classifiers are trained on ground-truth data formed by normal samples (negative data) and samples with defects (positive data), where the latter are consistently fewer than normal samples.

item.title: SOWA: Adapting Hierarchical Frozen Window Self-Attention to Visual-Language Models for Better Anomaly Detection
item.description: Visual anomaly detection is critical in industrial manufacturing, but traditional methods often rely on extensive normal datasets and custom models, limiting scalability.

item.title: Autoencoded Image Compression for Secure and Fast Transmission
item.description: With an exponential growth in the use of digital image data, the need for efficient transmission methods has become imperative.

item.title: Generalized Robust Fundus Photography-based Vision Loss Estimation for High Myopia
item.description: High myopia significantly increases the risk of irreversible vision loss.

item.title: CLIP-DR: Textual Knowledge-Guided Diabetic Retinopathy Grading with Ranking-aware Prompting
item.description: Diabetic retinopathy (DR) is a complication of diabetes and usually takes decades to reach sight-threatening levels.
